respiratory_diseases.detailed_description: Acute inflammation and infection of the maxillary sinuses characterized by facial pain, pressure, and nasal congestion lasting less than 4 weeks.
Unspecified asthma, uncomplicated; a chronic inflammatory airway disease causing reversible airflow obstruction, wheezing, and shortness of breath without acute exacerbation.
Pneumonia, unspecified organism; acute infection of the lung parenchyma causing inflammation of the alveoli and fluid accumulation, leading to cough and fever.

circulatory_diseases.detailed_description: Essential (primary) hypertension; chronic high blood pressure without a secondary identifiable cause, increasing the risk of cardiovascular events.
Atherosclerotic heart disease of native coronary artery without angina pectoris; narrowing of the heart's natural arteries due to plaque buildup in patients with no chest pain.
Cerebral infarction, unspecified; an ischemic stroke caused by the blockage of blood flow to the brain, resulting in localized tissue death (infarction).

mental_health_disorders.detailed_description: Major depressive disorder, single episode, unspecified; a clinical mood disorder characterized by persistent low mood, loss of interest, and functional impairment.
Generalized anxiety disorder (GAD); excessive, uncontrollable worry and apprehension about various activities or events, occurring more days than not for at least 6 months.
